answers.answer: Are you actually throwing up? Your hormone change in the last few weeks is common for causing "morning sickness" all over again. Plus you have to remember everything is super squished including your stomach and baby is taking most of your protein intake, vitamins etc. try always keeping something small in your stomach

I finally started keeping food down tonight.  One of my friends said she had this issues like this at the end of her pregnancy but the problem is I have the gestational diabetes so my blood sugar keeps dropping. I do feel better now though.

If it gets worse again, try talking to your dr about zofran. I've gotten sick again as well but don't have gestational diabetes. Which makes things even more difficult to manage. It stinks...but good news? It's almost over and munchkin is almost ready to be here!!!! :D Just a few more weeks!

Try peppermint i know your a diabetic but it will help your sugars stay up. Help with nausea too. There are b vitamin lollipops i got from my dr that help you eat. Also try smoothies they are light and packed with vitamins. Good luck.

This is what i've been like huni i'm 32weeks but most of mine is acid reflux that makes me sick onky thing thatnhelps me is eating little bits and drinking really cold water when it feels like imma throw up xxx hope it gets better babe

question: I  am 33 weeks and can't keep food down. I don't feel sick till I am about to throw up and then I am fine and starving so I start the cycle all over.  Anyone else going through this.
title: food not staying down
